The scanners should be able to meet the demand of a large quantity of special ballot applications in a short period of time. description: The information contained in this notice is a brief description of the requirement and is for information purposes only. Bidders must refer to the complete RFP document for a full description of the requirement and the full bid instructions. Background The Chief Electoral Officer of Canada (CEOC), an agent of Parliament, exercises general direction and supervision over the conduct of elections and referendums at the federal level. The CEOC heads the Office of the Chief Electoral Officer, commonly known as Elections Canada. The Alternative Voting Methods (AVM) directorate is responsible for the deployment of the vote by mail program. As a result of the COVID 19 pandemic, Elections Canada saw a significant increase in electors applying to vote by mail. The directorate has the responsibility to scan a portion of applications from electors who choose to vote by mail. The scanners that had been used in the past are no longer supported and can no longer meet the demand. Requirement EC requires three (3) high-volume scanners for their 440 Coventry facility to support various document scanning requirements in the 45th General Election (GE), and beyond. The scanners are intended to be used during Electoral Events (i.e general election), at which time EC must process a large quantity of special ballot applications in a short period of time. Security There is no security requirement applicable to this procurement. Period of the Contract The Contract period will be from the Effective Date of the Contract until December 31, 2023 . Submission of Proposals This RFP allows bidders to use the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation to transmit their proposals electronically. For further information, bidders must refer to Part 2 – Bidder Instructions, and Part 3 – Proposal Preparation Instructions of the RFP document. Proposals are to be addressed to the attention of the Contracting Authority and delivered, sealed, to the Proposal Receiving Unit on or before the bid closing date and time indicated on the front page of the RFP. For sending packages by courier or for dropping off, please note that the Proposal Receiving Unit at the Business Centre is open Mondays to Fridays from 8:00 to 12:00 and from 13:00 to 16:00 (Gatineau, Quebec time). Bids sent via email or facsimile will not be accepted. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Elections Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Selection Methodology Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest cost

full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Tender Details

* **Tender Title:** High-Volume Scanners
* **Contracting Entity:** Elections Canada
* **Reference Number:** cb-8335-87473692
* **Solicitation Number:** ECCP-RFP-2023-2367
* **Publication Date:** August 21, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** September 26, 2023 14:00:00

## Background

Elections Canada is seeking high-volume scanners to support the processing of special ballot applications during federal elections. Due to increased demand stemming from the COVID-19 pandemic, the organization requires reliable scanners to efficiently handle a high volume of documents.

## Requirements

Elections Canada needs three (3) high-volume scanners to be installed at their 440 Coventry facility. The scanners will be used to scan various types of documents, primarily during election periods, when the organization must process a large quantity of special ballot applications in a short period.

## Procurement Overview

* **Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
* **Methodology:** Competitive - Open bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

## Contract Terms

* **Contract Duration:** October 2, 2023 to December 31, 2023 (initial term)
* **Security:** No security requirements are applicable to this procurement.

## Tender Documents

* **RFP Document:** Available on the Canada Buy and Sell website
* **Submission Instructions:** Bidders must submit proposals electronically through the epost Connect service or in sealed envelopes to the Proposal Receiving Unit by the tender closing date.

## Contact Information

* **Contracting Authority:** Caila Palmer
* **Email:** proposition-proposal@elections.ca
* **Phone:** (873) 416-1930

## Enquiries and Debriefings

Bidders must submit all enquiries and communication directly to the Contracting Authority. Debriefings will be provided to unsuccessful bidders once the successful bidder has been announced. avid
If you need more information, please don't hesitate to reach out. Otherwise, utilize the following links to access relevant information:

* [Download the RFP Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/downloads/cb-8335-87473692-eccp-rfp-2023-2367-high-volume-scanners.pdf)
* [Access the Canada Buy and Sell website for Tender Details](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders)
